meanings.definition: The act of gathering or amassing a large quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: The accumulation of toys in the playroom made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent2: The accumulation of dust on the shelves required a thorough cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The accumulation of mismatched socks in the laundry basket was like a colorful puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her accumulation of knowledge on the subject was as vast as the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The accumulation of leaves in the yard created a crunchy carpet to walk on.

meanings.definition: The result of a gradual increase or buildup over time.
meanings.sent1: The accumulation of snow on the mountain peak was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The accumulation of savings in the bank account gave her a sense of security.
meanings.sent3: The accumulation of unread emails in his inbox was a digital mountain to conquer.
meanings.sent4: Her accumulation of experiences made her a wise storyteller.
meanings.sent5: The accumulation of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking display.
